title: [Large-scale] Political Science and International Relations Simulation Design and Operation Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of political science and international relations theory, understanding of negotiation and decision-making processes
context.additional_context: Enhancing competencies in effective simulation design and operation in non-face-to-face educational environments post-COVID-19

learning_goals: Learners can draft educational scenarios by applying the three stages (Design-Implementation-Evaluation) of the simulation design model (DImE)
Learners can analyze conflict resolution strategies and replicate decision-making processes in a simulated environment through international negotiation simulations
Learners can analyze simulation results using quantitative/qualitative assessment tools (e.g., feedback surveys, role-performance rubrics)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
